descriptions.tech: This SPA was built with React and Node.js. It allows the user to upload a text that is stored in the local server and then processed in Node before retrieving individual words for the user. It connects to a third-party API to fetch translations for each word and stores information on the LocalStorage to calculate the percentage of words known / unknown to the user.
descriptions.user: Love learning languages and reading? After uploading or pasting a text, this web application allows you to receive single word translations by clicking on the desired word. It includes statistics on known and unknown words as well as on word frequency in different texts.

descriptions.tech: These templates are built using simple javascript, HTML and CSS. They are designed for Anki, a learning app based on spaced repetition.
descriptions.user: Here are some Anki templates I have created for learning languages. These templates mark my first steps into the world of web development as well as my first contact with CSS and HTML.

descriptions.tech: This application was built entirely with javascript, CSS (SASS) and HTML. I also built a local server with Node and Express. It connects to the TV Maze API.
descriptions.user: A series finder that allows the user to filter shows by genre and add items to lists (favorite & watched). It includes a user section with statistics (number of shows watched/favorited), a user creation page as well as a landing that welcomes the user once a day.

descriptions.tech: A simple but pretty webpage built with React that connects to an external API.
descriptions.user: A simple page built with React that displays information about Pokémon.

descriptions.tech: First group project built with HTML, CSS and SASS. It includes a carousel made exclusively with HTML and a form that connects to Formspree.
descriptions.user: A group website with information on its members. It includes a form that allows visitors to get in touch with the developers.

descriptions.tech: A Visit Card generator built with SASS, Javascript and HTML. It includes a chatbot that interacts with the user as he/she fills out the form and a carousel with customer reviews of the website.
descriptions.user: Create your visit card with this 80s inspired website based on the videogame 'Maniac Mansion: the day of the tentacle'. The user can choose a color palette, upload a picture, add information and create a sharable online visit card that can be easily shared through twitter. Also, do not hover over the 'evil chatbot', he gets angry!

title: Refactor Visit Card Generator with react

descriptions.tech: This project was based on the visit card project. In this case the purpose was to refactor some code inherited from another team in plain javascript and to transform it to React while maintaining all functionality.
descriptions.user: A SPA for creating your own visit cards, this time built with React! (Based on an 'inherited' project).

descriptions.tech: This SPA was built using Javascript, HTML, CSS and React. I used react router to render different components and redirect the user when necessary. It makes a call to the API blabl to obtain the characters. Organizes the characters by id/name. Filters. The user can search for a character from the address bar by providing the id. It includes a loader.
descriptions.user: Wubba Lubba dubbed! This website allows you to search for characters from Rick & Morty by ID, name, gender, season, species and status. It is a spoiler free website, which means you won't see characters beyond your season of your choice! Characters are displayed in a beautiful grid which allows the user to click on individual cards that reveal more details on the selected character. It features a cool design, gifs and a special personalized 'Rick & Morty' character model based on the author!
